discover.name: This Is The Place Heritage Park
discover.address: 2601 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
discover.description: A living-history park featuring pioneer monuments, train rides, a petting zoo, and a Native American village that celebrates Utah’s heritage.

discover.name: Utah State Capitol
discover.address: 350 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84114
discover.description: Built in 1916, this neoclassical revival landmark offers guided tours, historic murals, and sweeping views of the city and mountains.

discover.name: Temple Square
discover.address: 50 North Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150
discover.description: The heart of Salt Lake City, this 35-acre plaza is home to the Salt Lake Temple, Tabernacle, Assembly Hall, and beautiful gardens.

discover.name: Liberty Park
discover.address: 600 E 900 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84105
discover.description: A large urban park featuring a lake, aviary, playgrounds, and picnic areas, making it a favorite spot for families and outdoor activities.

discover.name: Gilgal Sculpture Garden
discover.address: 749 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84102
discover.description: A hidden gem with whimsical and symbolic sculptures created by Thomas Battersby Child Jr., offering a unique artistic experience.

discover.name: Memory Grove Park
discover.address: 300 N Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84103
discover.description: A peaceful park with monuments, fountains, and creekside walking paths, dedicated to honoring Utah’s veterans.

discover.name: Pioneer Memorial Museum
discover.address: 300 N Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103
discover.description: A museum showcasing artifacts, manuscripts, and memorabilia from Utah’s earliest settlers, housed in a grand Grecian-style mansion.

discover.name: Washington Square Park
discover.address: 451 S State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84111
discover.description: A historic downtown park surrounding the Salt Lake City and County Building, often hosting festivals, markets, and community events.
